Name: DIAKOVERE Annastift
Kommentare:
(Translated by Google) I was there on October 29 for an outpatient knee surgery. 1 . problem was the day before was in the hip phone. Currently no one can be reached so I didn't know when it would be my turn. But from experience I was able to get it done very early on, which turned out to be smart.
The nursing staff was very nice, the doctor didn't go at all.

It started with our first conversation, when he looked at Mathilde and didn't see anything, unfortunately I have had something with my knee several times and therefore also have all the other old pictures for comparison, I saw what was wrong when I looked at it, well and the pain etc do not just come without a reason. Anyway, he looked very reluctantly and lo and behold, the patient did not imagine it as previously suspected. That's how he came across in his whole way from the start. After the operation it was short and sweet. Everything gone that bothered. Talk no 2 min. My room neighbor felt the same way. He seemed visibly overwhelmed and had a few problems with the German language.

Conclusion if I have an operation again at some point I won't go to Annastift anymore. It was the 2nd in 2 years at the 1st inpatient. The nursing staff was also great.

Name: DIAKOVERE Annastift
Kommentare:
(Translated by Google) KNEE PATIENTS SHOULD NOT TAKE THE STEP !!
In 2018 I was diagnosed with a cruciate ligament tear and in December of the same year I had the "pleasure" of having an operation there. The station was new and modern. The nurses were also competent and personable, but in January 2020 I was told that the surgeon likes to play the "Bibber".
Even on the MRI images, you could see that my cruciate ligament replacement had not been fixed where it should have been fixed by a specialist doctor and that it was just hanging around loosely. So it did not even begin to perform its function, which he showed in sporting activities due to instability. This was also confirmed in my recent operation by Dr. Kregehr, who is one of the best and most renowned sports medicine in Hanover.
And as always, the best comes to the end; I learned from my physiotherapist today that I was not the first victim of Anna Stift and that I suffered from inexperienced and irresponsible surgeons and still suffer.

CONCLUSION: I was able to enjoy a general anesthetic. And why? Of course, so that the cash register of the hospital and surgical team is increased and I have to be operated on again after about a year. I do not want to arouse pity, but human life is not to be trifled with and this is also not a laboratory where you can try anything you want or because of your incompetence. It is very unfortunate that a hospital needs to be reminded of this.

PS: Dear hospital, please save the tirades and leave my review uncommented. Thank you!
